articles.description:

articles.title: Should I Have Expressed a Different Intent? Counterfactual Generation for LLM-Based Autonomous Control
articles.title_zh: Should I Have Expressed a Different Intent? Counterfactual Generation for LLM-Based Autonomous Control
articles.description:
arXiv:2601.20090v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Large language model (LLM)-powered agents can translate high-level user intents into plans and actions in an environment. Yet after observing an outcome, users may wonder: What if I had phrased my intent differently? We introduce a framework that enables such counterfactual reasoning in agentic LLM-driven control scenarios, while providing formal reliability guarantees. articles.title: Endogenous Reprompting: Self-Evolving Cognitive Alignment for Unified Multimodal Models
articles.title_zh: Endogenous Reprompting: Self-Evolving Cognitive Alignment for Unified Multimodal Models
articles.description:
arXiv:2601.20305v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Unified Multimodal Models (UMMs) exhibit strong understanding, yet this capability often fails to effectively guide generation. We identify this as a Cognitive Gap: the model lacks the understanding of how to enhance its own generation process.
